briefdescription.para: Optional flags used for some placement methods.
List of feature parts.
Lookup table of label features (owned by the label feature provider that created them)
List of obstacle parts.
Returns whether the layer is currently active.
Returns the layer's arrangement policy.
Returns the layer's arrangement flags.
Returns whether labels placed at the centroid of features within the layer are forced to be placed inside the feature's geometry.
Chop layer features at the repeat distance *.
Returns the connected feature ID for a label feature ID, which is unique for all features which have been joined as a result of joinConnectedFeatures()

simplesect.para: connected feature ID, or -1 if feature was not joined

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of features in layer.
Returns true if the layer has curved labels.
Join connected features with the same label text.
Returns whether the layer will be labeled or not.
Returns the layer's labeling mode.
Returns whether connected lines will be merged before labeling.
Returns the layer's name.
Returns the obstacle type, which controls how features within the layer act as obstacles for labels.
Returns the layer's priority, between 0 and 1.

detaileddescription.para:
0 corresponds to highest priority, 1 to lowest priority.
setPriority

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to the associated provider.
Register a feature in the layer.

detaileddescription.para: Does not take ownership of the label feature (it is owned by its provider).

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the layer is currently active.

detaileddescription.para: Active means "is currently displayed or used as obstacles". When a layer is deactivated then feature of this layer will not be used for either labeling or as obstacles.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to make the layer active, or false to deactivate the layer

briefdescription.para: Sets the layer's arrangement policy.
Sets the layer's arrangement flags.
Sets whether labels placed at the centroid of features within the layer are forced to be placed inside the feature's geometry.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to force centroid labels to be within the feature. If set to false then the centroid may fall outside the feature.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the layer will be labeled.

simplesect.para: Layers are labelled if and only if labelLayer and active are true

parameterdescription.para: set to false disable labeling this layer

briefdescription.para: Sets the layer's labeling mode.
Sets whether connected lines should be merged before labeling.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to merge connected lines

briefdescription.para: Sets the obstacle type, which controls how features within the layer act as obstacles for labels.
Sets the layer's priority.

parameterdescription.para: layer priority, between 0 and 1. 0 corresponds to highest priority, 1 to lowest priority.

briefdescription.para: Sets how upside down labels will be handled within the layer.
Returns how upside down labels are handled within the layer.

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsAbstractLabelProvider *provider, const QString &name, QgsPalLayerSettings::Placement arrangement, double defaultPriority, bool active, bool toLabel, Pal *pal, bool displayAll=false)
memberdef.name: Layer

briefdescription.para: Create a new layer.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the layer (for stats, debugging - does not need to be unique)
Arrangement mode : how to place candidates
layer's prioriry (0 is the best, 1 the worst)
is the layer is active (currently displayed)
the layer will be labeled whether toLablel is true
if true, all features will be labelled even though overlaps occur

briefdescription.para: Add newly created feature part into r tree and to the list.
Add newly created obstacle part into r tree and to the list.
A set of features which influence the labeling process.
